avalancheActivity.comment: In some regions 5 to 10 cm of snow, but less in some localities, has fallen. The wind slabs can be released in some cases on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m. They are to be avoided in particular in terrain where there is a danger of falling,, in isolated cases also in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Slight increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of new snow and strong wind.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The new snow is lying on top of a weakly bonded old snowpack in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2200 m. The snowpack is faceted. The sometimes strong wind will transport the fresh and old snow significantly.
In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
In all regions as well as in all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The more recent wind slabs are mostly small. They can be released in isolated cases on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m, especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain in extremely steep terrain.
In some regions 5 to 10 cm of snow, but less in some localities, has fallen above approximately 2000 m.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Hardly any increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of new snow and strong wind.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 2 to 5 cm of snow, but less in some localities, has fallen above approximately 2000 m. The new snow is lying on top of a weakly bonded old snowpack in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2200 m. The old snowpack is faceted and weak. The sometimes strong wind will transport the fresh and old snow significantly.
In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
In all regions below approximately 2000 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche prone locations are very rare. The small wind slabs can still be released in some cases especially on extremely steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m.
In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
avalancheActivity.highlights: In all regions from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The old snowpack is faceted and weak. In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Below approximately 2000 m from a snow sport perspective, insufficient snow is lying.
